[@Nereid](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/68815-nereid/)FYI

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed7507166753" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/152136-ksp-143-galileos-planet-pack-v1630-9-may-2018/&do=embed&comment=3387332&embedComment=3387332&embedDo=findComment" style="height:282px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

[@Z-Key Aerospace](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138926-z-key-aerospace/) and [@Warezcrawler](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/145377-warezcrawler/) I'm not sure whose actively maintaining this mod at the moment, and reading back a few pages I see warezcrawler seems to have released a few dll updates, so I wasn't sure who to ping, so forgive me. I'm reaching out to you on behalf of Angel-125 in regards to his mod:

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed6982589609" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/173857-14x-pre-release-live-kerbal-flying-saucers-build-flying-saucers-in-ksp/&page=13&tab=comments&do=embed&comment=3392940&embedComment=3392940&embedDo=findComment#comment-3392940" style="height:282px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

Has added 2 experiments that xscience is recognizing and giving science points when it shouldn't, and he was wanting to see if xscience could be modified to exclude these experiments so credit isn't being given for conducting these experiments The experiments in question are: GravioliumStudy and wbiSaucerResearchExperiment. He tried patching things on his end so that xscience wouldn't see the experiments, but was not successful. Again, sorry if I've pinged the wrong individuals, and thank you for your time.

[@Z-Key Aerospace](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138926-z-key-aerospace/) & [@Warezcrawler](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/145377-warezcrawler/)

I've implemented this in both the KEI and Experiment Tracker mods which I maintain.

They both are using the same file (KEI, since it already had a number of excluded experiments).

It's fairly easy to do, feel free to grab my code, from here:  [https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/ExperimentTracker/blob/7ef2f128bc13613d8f3e9fc73591ad8923f383bf/ExperimentTracker/ExperimentTracker.cs#L47-L96](https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/ExperimentTracker/blob/7ef2f128bc13613d8f3e9fc73591ad8923f383bf/ExperimentTracker/ExperimentTracker.cs#L47-L96)

and here:

[https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/ExperimentTracker/blob/7ef2f128bc13613d8f3e9fc73591ad8923f383bf/ExperimentTracker/ExperimentTracker.cs#L319-L332](https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/ExperimentTracker/blob/7ef2f128bc13613d8f3e9fc73591ad8923f383bf/ExperimentTracker/ExperimentTracker.cs#L319-L332)

The commented out lines are used in KEI, but not used (at present) in Experiment Tracker.

Would be great if you could use the same file, would make it much easier on mod authors to support this type of functionality

> 15 hours ago, vardicd said:
> 
> 
> Has added 2 experiments that xscience is recognizing and giving science points when it shouldn't, and he was wanting to see if xscience could be modified to exclude these experiments so credit isn't being given for conducting these experiments The experiments in question are: GravioliumStudy and wbiSaucerResearchExperiment. He tried patching things on his end so that xscience wouldn't see the experiments, but was not successful. Again, sorry if I've pinged the wrong individuals, and thank you for your time.
> 

The xscience has a similar functionality but it uses it's own definitions stored in science.cfg. This file can be used to exclude experiments as [I've done in this post](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/107661-ksp-143-x-science-ksp-science-report-and-checklist-v515/&do=findComment&comment=3110890)

[@Z-Key Aerospace](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138926-z-key-aerospace/) & [@Warezcrawler](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/145377-warezcrawler/) actually the time warp is always stopped when the situation changes - but the data is already gahtered and in the transmission queue of Kerbalism. [@N70](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/165182-n70/) [@PiezPiedPy](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/171747-piezpiedpy/)

Is it possible that [x] Science! just recognizes that the science data is already gathered and scheduled for Kerbalism transmission, so time warp will not be stopped?

Great mod, wonder if there is a keyboard shortcut to do the experiments...

(If not, is there a plan to add it as a new feature?)
btw just replacing [x] Science! with ScienceAlert helped getting rid off the game stops after each UI open / science available / science transmission.

Got a bit of a problem that may or may not be related to the way this mod works with 1.4.4 (which I know isn't supported yet) or something in 1.4.4 itself.... if that makes sense?

Anyway, I'm doing the usual 'build a rover with a scientist on board to collect data around the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr>' thang today and I am finding it really hard to get some of the biomes. Rather than getting "Landed <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> Main Building (Shores)", when I touch the object in question I get "Landed at Kerbin's Vehicle Main Assembly Building" with no available experiments. I back away and it doesn't change back until I go on EVA or move to somewhere like Mission Control.

I noticed some of the R&D biomes were in specific spots (like doorways), did they make them smaller and more specific?

Here is another mod that can help make an early rover to get <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> Science.

[https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/171377-14x-grounded-modular-vehicles-r20-mobile-stairs-<abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">ksc</abbr>-service-vehicles-more-car-parts-mar-18-2018/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/171377-14x-grounded-modular-vehicles-r20-mobile-stairs-ksc-service-vehicles-more-car-parts-mar-18-2018/)

Awesome mod, can't believe I played career without it before! I have a feature request if you would consider it, currently it's super annoying that I can't see which experiments I did in the Mobile Lab, and this mod looks like a function like that would fit it perfectly. Like an orange dot next to experiments that have been put in the mobile lab would go a super long way.

Thanks for the awesome work.

Could support for the following mod be added?  It support science in different biomes.

I have an odd issue with xScience. I think it started a couple months ago after one of KSP updates. The Here&Now window shows a lot of experiments that are actually completed as available. E.g. it shows that Temperature Scan hasn't been done, but in fact it's been a long, long time ago.

I suspect it may have something to do with Science Revisited Revisited, but I'm pretty sure it didn't happen before.

Kinda new to KSP and modding esp, but my installation of <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> doesn't seem to be aware of the new (1.4.5 compatible) version of the mod. Is there something I have to

do for it to update properly?   

Thanks!

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Johnny Chemo said:
> 
> 
> Kinda new to KSP and modding esp, but my installation of <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> doesn't seem to be aware of the new (1.4.5 compatible) version of the mod. Is there something I have to
> 
> 
> 
> 
> do for it to update properly?   
>   
> 
> Thanks!
> 

Uninstall mod in <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>.

Unpack [this](http://themoose.co.uk/ksp/x-science-v5.17.zip) in your KSP folder.

Reload <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> (to "detect" new mod in it).
